newsitem.title: USA: Verity sees first quarter loss of $1.3 million.
newsitem.headline: Verity sees first quarter loss of $1.3 million.

text.p: Verity Inc. Thursday said it expects to post a loss of about $1.3 million or 12 cents a share in its first fiscal quarter ended Aug. 31.

In a statement, the Sunnyvale, Calif.-based provider of software products said it expected first quater revenues to total around $8.8 million, up from $5.5 million a year ago, but down from $10 million in the fourth quarter of last year.
"We are disappointed in the results for the quarter," said Verity Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Philippe Courtot.
"Nevertheless, we are very confident in the fundamentals of our business, and the potential opportunities of the emerging market for our products. "

The company said the first quarter loss would compare with a net loss of $436,000, or 21 cents a share, on a smaller number of shares, for the same quarter of the prior year, and net income of $350,000, or 3 cents a share, for the fourth quarter.
